content:
About Me #I am a Ph.D. candidate in National University of Singapore, School of Computing. I am currently advised by Prof. Harold Soh.
I specializes in algorithm design, machine learning, and optimization, with a focus on applying mathematical modeling and principled algorithmic techniques to solve real-world problems. Currently, my work explores fairness in repeated matching problems.

Publications #Fairness in Repeated Matching: A Maximin Perspective
Eugene Lim, Tzeh Yuan Neoh, Nicholas Teh
Under Review, 2025
Stochastic Bandits for Egalitarian Assignment
Eugene Lim, Vincent Y. F. Tan, Harold Soh

Teaching #I enjoy teaching and find it rewarding to help students grow and succeed. I’ve been fortunate to receive the NUS SoC Honor List of Student Tutors awards for 2020/2021 and 2023/2024, as well as the NUS SoC Teaching Fellowship for 2023/2024 and 2025/2026. Below is a record of my teaching experiences
CS5340: Uncertainty Modelling in AI #2023/2024, Semester 2
CS3264: Foundations of Machine Learning #2024/2025, Semester 1
2023/2024, Semester 1
CS3244: Machine Learning #2022/2023, Special Term
